newsitem.title: USA: Evacuations ordered in Arkansas plant explosion.
newsitem.headline: Evacuations ordered in Arkansas plant explosion.

text.p: An explosion at a chemical plant in northeast Arkansas Thursday released toxic gases into the air and forced the evacuation of a nearby hospital, emergency officials said.
Firefighters had flames under control at the BPS Co. chemical plant in West Helena, and there were no immediate reports of deaths or injuries from the blast, officials said.
"We understand the fire is now under control, but officials there are asking people to remain out of the area," said Francis Huddleston, an Arkansas Office of Emergency Services spokesperson.
The explosion released an "unknown quantity of toxic gas," Huddleston said.
Patients from Helena Regional Hospital were evacuated to a nearby community college as a precaution after the early afternoon blast, Huddleston said.
The explosion rocked the manufacturing and farming community located along the Mississippi River near the tri-state border with Tennessee and Mississippi, Huddleston said.
